description.narrative: The project will help provide financing to microenterprises in Nigeria. The most significant expected project level outcome for the project is access to finance for microenterprises to support economic activity and resilience in the aftermath of the COVID-19 crisis. Beyond the project outcome, IFC anticipates that the Project will support resilience amongst microfinance and BOP finance providers catalyzing investments in the sector by demonstrating the viability of lending to BOP providers and crowding in other sources of international and domestic finance in support of these lenders.

The proposed investment consists of an up to three-year senior loan of US$5 million in local currency to Grooming People for Better Livelihood Centre (the Organization or Grooming Centre), a long-standing IFC client, under the Base of the Pyramid Program (BOP Program), part of the IFC Fast Track COVID-19 Facility. The BOP Program is designed to enable Grooming Centre to provide much needed local currency funding to micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) that have been negatively affected by the COVID-19 pandemic in Nigeria. The Project is supported by IDA PSW Blended Finance Facility.
